prompt:
Can you provide a consice description of the histopathology image shown?
<image>
text: The histopathology image shows a subepithelial cleft, which is a separation between the epidermis and the underlying dermis in the skin tissue. This cleft is associated with an inflammatory infiltrate, which is a collection of immune cells that have migrated to the area in response to inflammation or injury. The image is stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and has a magnification of 100x.

prompt:
Can you provide a consice description of the histopathology image shown?
<image>
text: The histopathology image shows a lymph node with retained nodal architecture. There is a prominent germinal center reaction, which is characterized by the proliferation of lymphoid cells. The germinal center is surrounded by a rim of mantle zone lymphocytes. The image is stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and has an original magnification of ×20.

prompt:
Can you provide a consice description of the histopathology image shown?
<image>
text: The histopathology image shows a polyp with hyperplasia of Brunner's glands in the lamina propria. Brunner's glands are specialized glands found in the duodenum, which is the first part of the small intestine. Hyperplasia refers to an increase in the number of cells, leading to an enlargement of the tissue. In this case, the polyp has an increased number of Brunner's glands, giving it a characteristic appearance.

text: The histopathology image shown is of the small intestine. It is stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and has an original magnification of ×4. The image provides a detailed view of the tissue structure and cellular composition of the small intestine, which can help in understanding any abnormalities or pathological changes present in the tissue.

prompt:
Can you provide a consice description of the histopathology image shown?
<image>
text: The histopathology image shows a liver biopsy with features of steatohepatitis. There is a zone 3 predominance of macrovesicular steatosis, which means there are large fat droplets in the liver cells. Additionally, there is lobular spotty necrosis, which refers to localized areas of cell death within the liver lobules. The image is stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and has an original magnification of ×20.

Can you provide a consice description of the histopathology image shown?
<image>
text: The histopathology image shows a liver biopsy with features of acute cellular rejection. This is characterized by portal inflammation, cholestasis, and interface hepatitis. The image is stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) and has a 100x magnification.
